info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:47PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northeastern Kit Carson County in east central Colorado, western Cheyenne and Thomas Counties in northwestern Kansas, northeastern Logan County in west central Kansas, southwestern Sheridan and Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas, Gove County in west central Kansas and western Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 630 PM MDT/730 PM CDT/... At 544 PM MDT/644 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wray to 13 miles north of Goodland to 11 miles southwest of Collyer. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wray. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 6 and 113. Highway 385 between mile markers 212 and 270. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Rainfall rates in excess of three inches per hour are possible from the stronger slow moving storms. As a result, visibilities as low as one half mile are possible with an increasing threat for localized flash flooding.
